meanings.definition: To make something outdated or no longer current.
meanings.sent1: Technology is constantly outdating older models.
meanings.sent2: The new software update is outdating the previous version.
meanings.sent3: The rapid pace of innovation is outdating yesterday's inventions.
meanings.sent4: The evolution of fashion trends is outdating traditional styles.
meanings.sent5: The digital age is outdating many analog practices.

meanings.definition: To become outdated or no longer current.
meanings.sent1: Old technology is quickly outdating in today's world.
meanings.sent2: Fashion trends are always outdating themselves.
meanings.sent3: His jokes are outdating faster than he can tell them.
meanings.sent4: The once popular app is slowly outdating as new competitors emerge.
meanings.sent5: The knowledge in this field is constantly outdating, requiring continuous learning.
